I want to thank cosponsors @RepRaskin @RepMcGovern @RoKhanna @repjimcooper @RepScottPeters for their support, and nonpartisan organizations including @fairvote @repwomen @FemMajority for helping with this ambitious legislation. Read more about it here: 5/5 https://beyer.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=4487 …

At a time when Americans have waning faith in institutions and political leadership, the Fair Representation Act would help restore the trust which so many have lost in our political system, and make genuine bipartisanship for progress a possibility. 4/

Congressional districts across the country would suddenly become competitive. The votes of Democrats in rural districts and Republicans in urban ones would have stronger impacts. It would create new pathways to elect women and candidates of color, while weakening partisanship. 3/

The Fair Representation Act would move US House elections into multi-member districts drawn by independent redistricting commissions, elected through ranked choice voting.

These measures would give congressional candidates incentives to appeal to a broader range of voters. 2/

Last month the Supreme Court issued a ruling in @CommonCause v. Rucho upholding political gerrymandering. It was a bad decision that will hurt our democracy.

Today I introduced the Fair Representation Act, which would end gerrymandering, and do more to improve our elections. 1/ pic.twitter.com/n59pQb5QzS

I will continue to advocate for an impeachment inquiry including investigatory hearings, document production, and witness testimony which we need to fully and fairly evaluate the case for impeaching President Trump.

We need to do this, and we need to do it right.

We must marshal our best evidence on obstruction, emoluments violations, and other potential crimes, not simply focus on the President’s latest horrible remarks, harmful though they are.

I worry the House would forfeit its vital role in this process if today’s resolution passed.

The House must have the ability to investigate and establish the facts, build the evidence required to educate the public about the President’s wrongdoing, and put ourselves in a position to make the strongest possible case to the Senate before voting on articles of impeachment.

I have been vocal in my condemnation of those tweets and his other racist statements and actions, but I do not believe this is the best way forward on impeachment. https://twitter.com/repdonbeyer/status/1150537893594750976?s=21 …

We have a duty to act on them and establish the truth for the American people. This resolution does not address those acts. It would initiate an impeachment trial in the Senate solely to consider whether the President should be removed from office for his recent racist tweets.

We have substantial evidence in the Mueller Report and elsewhere that the President has committed obstruction of justice and potentially other high crimes and misdemeanors which meet the standard for impeachment which the Founders laid out in the Constitution.

I strongly support an impeachment inquiry into the conduct of President Trump. I voted to table H. Res. 489 because it would effectively prevent the House from conducting such an inquiry. https://twitter.com/RepDonBeyer/status/1151632230466359296 …
